name: Cmis4owncloud
tagline: Here an CMIS adaptor for owncloud build. It will use the Owncloud API, Apache Chemistry and leverage the Android Client for Owncloud as a starting point
body:
## UPDATE (25.11.2014): Beta 0.2 is ready. You can now use the proxy to have a site mapped to a share

### OLDER NEWS:
Beta 0.1 is ready. You can now use the proxy to do basic CRUD actions on the owncloud-repo


### Welcome to CMIS4Owncloud.
If you want to get started, do the following:

1. build apache chemistry with maven: 
http://chemistry.apache.org/opencmis-how-to-build.html
2. download tomcat server 
3. build the project with maven using mvn clean package
4. Run \chemistry-opencmis-server\chemistry-opencmis-server-inmemory on tomcat
5. check [http://localhost:8080/chemistry-opencmis-server-inmemory/](http://localhost:8080/chemistry-opencmis-server-inmemory/) for success
6. change WEB-INF/classes/owncloud.properties to reflect your owncloud instance

This will create the proxy. You can now add any CMIS-Client and navigate owncloud.  In order to test this, you can use the OpenCMIS Workbench from http://chemistry.apache.org/java/download.html

### Authors and Contributors
For now I am the only one working on this with my team. But help is always welcome.

### Support or Contact
julian.dehne@gmail.com
